title: MAG 083 - Drawing a Blank - Transcript
text:
The Magnus Archives – MAG083 – Drawing a Blank 
1 
 
MAG – 083 – Drawing a Blank 
Content warnings: 
• Mannequins 
• Murder 
• Body horror 
Discussions of: Insomnia, trauma, paranormal encounter 
Mentions of: ableism, human remains, paranoia, strangulation 
SFX: low drone, high pitched tone 
[The Magnus Archives Theme – Intro] 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Rusty Quill presents: The Magnus Archives. Episode eighty-three. Drawing a 
Blank. 
[The Magnus Archives theme – intro – continues.] 
[Tape clicks on.] 
GEORGIE 
Sure, I just – Why? 
ARCHIVIST 
I just do. It’s, it’s my job. I record them. 
GEORGIE 
The job you just lost. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG083 – Drawing a Blank 
2 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Uh… yes. 
GEORGIE 
That one you lost so badly it somehow cost you all your stuff? 
ARCHIVIST 
Well, it’s not quite that simple. 
GEORGIE 
Well, how am I to know? 
ARCHIVIST 
Look, Georgie, it’s not… You don’t need to worry. I mean, I’m not, I’m not on 
drugs or anything. 
(Georgie laughs) 
What? (Pause) I could be on drugs! 
GEORGIE 
Sure. I just… I know that you get obsessive about stuff, and this right here, I… 
I’m guessing someone dragged you into something weird, you got hooked in 
and then it all went wrong. 
ARCHIVIST 
I mean, that is almost exactly what happened. 
GEORGIE 

The Magnus Archives – MAG083 – Drawing a Blank 
3 
 
So what you need now is… distance. 
ARCHIVIST 
You’re right. You’re right. I just… I need to record it. 
GEORGIE 
No, you don’t. This is not going to help. It’s part of the problem, isn’t it? Look 
me in the eyes and tell me that it’s not part of the cult or whatever the hell it 
was that left you homeless. (Pause) Come on. What’s it been, four days? 
ARCHIVIST 
Yeah. Yeah. 
GEORGIE 
It drops through the letter box and you spend four days… like this. It’s not – It 
isn’t right, John. You don’t sleep… 
ARCHIVIST 
I’ve been investigating. 
GEORGIE 
Hmm. 
ARCHIVIST 
Please, Georgie, I just need… I need to record it. That’s all. Then it’s done. 
GEORGIE 
Fine. Fine… But you have got to deal with whatever this is. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG083 – Drawing a Blank 
4 
 
ARCHIVIST 
I will. I, I promise. 
GEORGIE 
Okay. And just so you know: not keen on your weird stalkers knowing my 
address. Not keen on that. 
ARCHIVIST 
Right. 
[Georgie leaves, shutting the door behind her.] 
Right. 
Statement of Chloe Ashburt, regarding a new window display at Fanton’s 
department store in Hammersmith. Original statement given 19th October 
2013. Audio recording by Jonathan Sims, Hea– 
Audio recording by Jonathan Sims. 
Statement begins. 
ARCHIVIST (STATEMENT) 
Working in a large department store can be kind of strange. I’ve had jobs in a 
couple over the last few years, and talked to people who’ve worked in others, 
and they all seem to operate slightly differently. 
Some treat every department almost as a separate business, with its own 
dedicated team, some move their workforce around regularly, so they don’t 
get too comfortable. A few operate almost entirely by leasing out spaces to
